This problem occurs only in Internet Explorer (6,7,8), does not occur in Mozilla, and does not depent on MS Office version.

fields.description:
When using the panel macro (or noformat, or code, etc.) before a table, switching to Wiki markup when using Rich Text editor as the default editor breaks table's header.

To replicate:
# With Rich Text Editor as the default editor, create a page with the following content:
{code}
{panel}Some content{panel}
|| row 1 || row 1 ||
| row 2 | row 2 |
{code}
# Save the page.
# Edit again and switch to Wiki Markup editor.
# Edit the content of the table.
# Save the page.
# Watch it break.
fields.summary: Switching between rich text editor to wiki markup added extra backward slash in Confluence table's header when there is a panel macro declared before the table

fields.description: A fellow employee was asking how to bulk upload attachments to Confluence. I told him to use webDAV but then quickly learned there are no end-user instructions for how webDAV works. Now that WebDAV is bundled with Confluence, can we please add WebDAV instructions to the user guide? Cheers!
fields.summary: Add WebDAV instructions to the user guide

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Upload a profile image
# Make a change in a public space
# Modify global permissions so that anonymous doesn't have access to user profiles
# Log out
# Go to the dashboard

A broken image will be present next to your user name in the recently updated section.

In firefox this is issue is not visible (broken image just doesn't render), but in Safari and possibly IE there is a broken image placeholder rendered instead of the image.

The same issue affects comments on wiki pages which will most likely affect more users than the dashboard alone.

An unfortunate side effect of this bug a significant performance penalty that is a result of http redirection to the login page and retrieval of this page for all links to profile images. Under normal circumstances all profile images are cached in the browser, so this is not an issue. Browsers however won't cache 302 redirections.
fields.summary: Profile images throughout Confluence are broken when anonymous view profile permission is off

fields.description:
[Example|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/How+to+audit+Confluence+-+enabling+user+access+logging#HowtoauditConfluence-enablinguseraccesslogging-Advancedconfiguration]

{code}
log4j.appender.accesslog.File=${catalina.home}/logs/atlassian-confluence-access.log
{code}

Users may mistakenly use backslashes instead of forward slashes, which results in malfunctioned logging:

{code}
log4j.appender.accesslog.File=${catalina.home}\logs\atlassian-confluence-access.log
{code}

It would be nice if we put up a warning/reminder regarding this on this [page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/How+to+audit+Confluence+-+enabling+user+access+logging]

On a related note, our _log4j.properties_ has this warning:

{code}
###########################
# Note for Windows Users  #
###########################
#
# Each backslash in your path must be written as a forward slash.
# - For example:
# c:\confluence\data
#
# should be written as:
#
# c:/confluence/data
{code}
fields.summary: Add reminder to use forward slashes instead of backslashes in proprties file

fields.description:
According to the [userlister documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Userlister+Macro] when you do not pass the online parameter you are supposed to get this:

|| What you need to type || What you will get ||
| {code}
{userlister:groups=*}
{code} | !http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/145958/userlist.gif?version=1&modificationDate=1133223759164! |

But instead it has the "offline" added to the title

!offline.jpg!

It should just show everyone in the group, regardless of the status, without the "offline" part.
fields.summary: Userlister macro has "offline" appended to the title when you don't pass the online parameter

fields.description:
Users that do not have PersonalInformation objects cannot Create a Personal Space because the link is missing.

The log indicates that the transaction created is read-only, even though the PersonalInformationManager.getPersonalInformation() method can be a write operation.  The easiest way to fix this is to make sure the PersonalInformationManager requires a full transaction instead of a read-only one.  That could conceivably have drawbacks though, assuming there's significant value in having read-only transactions most of the time, so we may want to find another solution.

The logs show an error like this:
{noformat}

 -- url: /confluence/dashboard.action | userName: yzs330
org.springframework.dao.InvalidDataAccessApiUsageException: Write operations are not allowed in read-only mode (FlushMode.NEVER): Turn your Session into FlushMode.AUTO or remove 'readOnly' marker from transaction definition.

fields.description: Hello.  It appears that the ability for users to remove attachments from a space is controlled exclusively by the status of the confluence-users group permissions.  When I set permissions to remove attachments at the individual user level, the setting appears to have no effect.  It seems that removing attachments can only be secured at a group level.  More granular control is required in this case.
fields.summary: Space Permissions Bug:  confluence-users group permissions conflict with individual user permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16598].
  {panel}

I would like an option for making page changes a two step process.
The first step would be to make the changes to the page, as it is now. When you are done with that you click "Next", and you are then taken to another page which shows a diff of the changes you've made, and allows you to enter a comment for the changes made.

I see some benefits to this:
# You can spot any errors you may have made, which can't easily be spotted on the preview tab. Ie. if you get to remove a row from a table when you just meant to edit one field.
# It makes it easier to get an overview of what changes you have made to the page, in order to summarize them in the comment.
# The extra page should have a "Back" link which would allow you to go back and edit the page again, in case you spot any errors in the changes you've made.

This should probably be made as an option, possibly per user, since it otherwise would change the work flow of existing installations.
fields.summary: Make page modifications an (optional) two step process, improves diffs and summary notes

fields.description:
As mentioned in CONF-17499, some pages take a long time to diff.  In Confluence instances where RSS is used widely, the result of such a page being updated can result in a great amount of requests to diff that page.  Thread dumps will have many entries from {{createrssfeed.action}} actions like this one:

{noformat}
"TP-Processor23" daemon prio=10 tid=0x088a9000 nid=0x6fbe runnable [0x5f9b7000..0x5f9bada0]
  java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at org.apache.commons.jrcs.diff.myers.PathNode.previousSnake(PathNode.java:123)
	at org.apache.commons.jrcs.diff.myers.DiffNode.<init>(DiffNode.java:45)
	at org.apache.commons.jrcs.diff.myers.MyersDiff.buildPath(MyersDiff.java:153)
	at org.apache.commons.jrcs.diff.myers.MyersDiff.diff(MyersDiff.java:93)
	at org.apache.commons.jrcs.diff.Diff.diff(Diff.java:197)
	at org.apache.commons.jrcs.diff.Diff.diff(Diff.java:185)
	at org.apache.commons.jrcs.diff.Diff.diff(Diff.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.diff.DeltaRanker.getChangeRanking(DeltaRanker.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.diff.LineRanker.getIndexOfSmallestChange(LineRanker.java:30)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.diff.LineLevelDiffer.getChunksForChangedLines(LineLevelDiffer.java:214)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.diff.LineLevelDiffer.diff(LineLevelDiffer.java:91)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.diff.LineLevelDiffer.diff(LineLevelDiffer.java:346)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.diff.LineLevelDiffer.diff(LineLevelDiffer.java:333)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.diff.ConfluenceDiff.<init>(ConfluenceDiff.java:22)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.diff.ConfluenceDiff.<init>(ConfluenceDiff.java:29)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.rss.PageRenderSupport.getDiff(PageRenderSupport.java:98)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.rss.PageRenderSupport.getRenderedContent(PageRenderSupport.java:64)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.rss.DefaultFeedBuilder.createFeed(DefaultFeedBuilder.java:103)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor628.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at $Proxy62.createFeed(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.actions.CreateRssFeedAction.getSyndFeed(CreateRssFeedAction.java:51)
{noformat}

To address this in Confluence 3.1, a limit was introduced to the maximum number of concurrent diffs.  When that number is exceeded, additional attempts by RSS feeds to create diffs are ignored and logged.  (The RSS requests succeed, they are just missing diffs).

h3. Option configuration
The size of the threadpool defaults to 20, and can be configured with the system property "confluence.diff.pool.size".
The default timeout is 1000 ms, and can be configured with the system property "confluence.diff.timeout".

fields.description:
Editing a document in Word and Firefox fails if the page title contains non-english page titles - WebDav launcher does not support nonenglish symbols in URL. 

Examples include Korean or Russian page titles. 

+Steps to replicate+
# Direct yourself to a page 
# Create a new page with the following title:
{code}
소스 보기
{code}
# Save the changes
# Now use the option *Edit in Word* via _Tools >> Edit in Word_

\\
+Snapshot of the error:+
!docdoesnotexist.png!

\\ 
+This issue can be replicate using:+  
Firefox 3.0.x and Firefox 3.5.5
WebDAV 1.0.3 Firefox plugin

However, there is no problem editing a Confluence page in word with umlaut character as the title of the page.
fields.summary: Edit in Word with Firefox plugin fails with non-english page titles - WebDav launcher does not support nonenglish symbols in URL

It seems that this [method|https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/browse/confluence/plugins/pdfexport/trunk/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/extra/flyingpdf/BetterExportSpaceAction.java?r=HEAD#l109] did not get populated.

If more information is needed please let me know.

Thanks.

fields.description:
As per CONF-1711 I'm opening a request to be able to future-date blog posts.

There are some spaces where blogs aren't used as a blog - they are used for meetings, call schedules, etc.

Use case:

We have a meetings space on our wiki where currently each meeting gets a plain old wiki page. We do this purely because we can't future date blog posts which prevents us from scheduling a meeting in the future.

If we could future date blog posts it would be much better because then we'd have the blog calendar showing when meetings are happening - past, present and future.

We don't want future-dated blog posts to be hidden or anything like that - we want them to be visible. We can then scroll in to the future to see what meetings are upcoming.

This would be extremely useful for dealing with any kind of scheduled event.
fields.summary: Ability to future date blog posts

fields.description:
Even with browser caching, IE seems to be taking 2-3x longer to render the addpage/editpage.action due to the added complexity of the js resources involved.

This leads to full render times of 6-14 seconds in situations where the cache is purged/caching is disabled.  (times taken from fiddler parses from localhost).

This is in contrast to FF taking half the time on the same test system.

Although consistent with the benchmark values taken from this [source|http://celtickane.com/labs/web-browser-javascript-benchmark/], 6 seconds to load a page without network latency is slow.
fields.summary: Improve performance of loading the TinyMCE editor and macro browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16557].
  {panel}

To demonstrate this limitation, please refer to the following steps:

# Create a space
# In the "Home" page, add the following content:
{code}
h1. Heading A
h2. Heading B
h1. Heading C
{code}
# Create a child page "Child" with this content:
{code}
h1. Heading D
h2. Heading E
h1. Heading F
{code}
# Export the space to PDF

In the resultant PDF:

* "Home" is displayed as the prime heading (h1)
* "Heading A" is displayed as h2, "Heading B" is displayed as h3, and so on
* However, "Child" (the child page title) is displayed as h2 (not h1), "Heading D" is displayed as h3 and so on <-- this is the limitation

In other words, you can see that on the first page the headings are increased by one:

||Wiki||PDF||
|Page Title|h1|
| "h1."|h2|
| "h2."|h3|
|...|...|

From the second (child page) on, headings are increased by two:
||Wiki||PDF||
|Page Title| h2|
|"h1."|h3|
|"h2."|h4|
|...|...|


Because of this reason it's not possible to do a senseful page numbering with css counters. If the headings would be shifted on all pages in the same way, this would be no problem.

A suggestion would be that Page Titles always get h1 in the PDF export and the content headings are always only shifted by 1. Additionally (to keep the possibility to define something like a title page with the very first page title), the very first page title could get something like <h1 class="very_first_page_title">.
fields.summary: PDF export to cater for better heading formatting

fields.description:
For some reason the middle two headings are not being rendered as headings - they show 'h2.' in the rendered wiki page:

{code}
h2. 4. Mail merge

See my comment on mail merge functionality lower down page.
 
h2. 5. foo  in  the  news

This is just a wiki space with some custom 'add page' links IMHO. Maybe customise home page with tag cloud, recent updates and rss feed.
   
h2. 6. Forecast  /  Monitor  activities  

* Ability to list who's been contacted between two dates 

h2. 7. Filter / Search within CRM space
{code}

in the wiki page we get:
{quote}
....

h2. 5. foo  in  the  news

...

h2. 6. Forecast  /  Monitor  activities  

....
{quote}

Everything else renders fine, including all the other headings on the page, lists, text formatting, etc.

The content was manually entered as wiki markup and double-checked the heading syntax (eg. making sure the . was actually a . and not some weird unicode character).

The page is just a bog standard wiki page with no embelishments. There are no macros on the page, just very basic text, lists and headings.

Will attach some screenies to show the problem in action. Looks like some weirdness with the wiki renderer but no idea why this would happen - certainly never seen anything like this before and I've been using Confluence since v1.3 and have authored thousands of pages over the past few years.
fields.summary: utf8 characters break markup rendering

fields.description:
Special characters in the title of the home page cause the delete page showing up when visiting the space. 

The steps to reproduce this. 

1. Create a space and a home page title with a special character (for example: "confluence & jira")
2. Go to the home page and delete it. 
3. Try to access the space link from the dashboard. Confluence is trying to use the following URL to access the home page(http://<hostname:portnumber>/display/<spacekey>/<homepagename>), but it is redirected to the following url (http://<hostname:portnumber>/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=<valueofpageid>) and can be accessible due to the special character in the page title.
4. The result is the users still can access the page not knowing it was deleted (Users still can add comments to it).
fields.summary: Special characters in the title of the home page cause the deleted home page showing up when visiting the space link.

fields.description:
When building the link to an attachment on the current page, we typically tell our users to go to the attachment view, select the filename with the mouse, choose Edit > Copy, then go back to the page and paste it in, e.g., 
\[Current newsletter|^Merrill Lynch 2009 Q3 Business Plann.pdf\]

On filenames containing more than 1 consecutive space, the Attachment view displays the filename as containing only single spaces, so the copy-paste technique generates an invalid link.  Only by editing the attachment, can they see/get the "real" filename to use in a link.

See attachments for an example.
fields.summary: Attachment view shows filenames with double spaces turned into single spaces

fields.description:
Hi,

[background-optional to read]
Since Confluence 3.0 I would like to use the new PDF export feature to produce external documentation. 
I have to use a single page export as I have several documentations in the same space. 
With the single page export to PDF, I can't benefit of the table of contents rendered by the PDF export. So I would like to use the toc macro to render my own table of contents in the PDF documentation. 
[/background]

I try to use the toc macro to generate my table of contents in a documentation, however for each items with the same name, the generated anchor are identical. 

So in the following example :


{code}
h1. Chapter 1
h2. Introduction

h1. Chapter 2
h2. Introduction
{code}

The table of contents will generate the same link for the two "Introduction" items. 
{code}
[Document#Introduction]
{code}

Especially confusing when rendering in a very large PDF export.
fields.summary: Incorrect links when two items have the same name in the document

Mr Andy Brook already reproduced the bug. Refering to:

fields.description:
The [existing docs|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/SharePoint+Connector+for+Confluence] for the Sharepoint Connector are in sore need of some Tech Writer attention, particularly the installation instructions.

1) There are lots of similarly titled pages - it's hard to know where to start:
* [Installing the SharePoint Connector for Confluence|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Installing+the+SharePoint+Connector+for+Confluence]
* [Install the SharePoint Feature|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Install+the+SharePoint+Feature]
* [SharePoint Installer|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/SharePoint+Installer]
* [Manual SharePoint Feature Installation  |http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Manual+SharePoint+Feature+Installation]

2) The instructions themselves are confusing - it seems to suggest that I should install the SharePoint bits first, then the Confluence plugin second, but if I do it in that order I get errors

3) There should be a list of prerequisites - otherwise you find out during the install that [another plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Permission+Checker+RPC+Plugin] also needed

4) The documentation for the SP Connector doesn't really belong in CONFEXT at all - it should either be part of the DOC space, or have a dedicated space on CAC.
fields.summary: Sharepoint Connector documentation needs some attention

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16527].

Due to the advent of the new PDF export functionalities in Confluence 3.0, customising the export via Velocity files is no longer relevant. 

This results in some limitations where it is no longer possible to use [Velocity Content Objects|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Available+Velocity+Context+Objects+in+Exporters] for the PDF exports. For instance, there is no way to include the following items in the exports:

fields.description:
It looks like you are using a customized theme, and this theme is not referencing the correct URL of the PDF stylesheets page.

The theme is currently referencing the page is:

http://xxx.xxx.xx/spaces/flyingpdf/viewpdfconfig.action?key=$space.key

(notice the $space.key instead of the real space key, TEST )

This is incorrect. The correct URL is as follows:

http://xxx.xxx.xx/spaces/flyingpdf/viewpdfconfig.action?key=TEST

If you plug in the 2nd URL you will be presented with the PDF stylesheet page where you can edit and save the pdf stylesheet.

You'll also want to update your theme in order to permanently resolve this issue.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16522].
  {panel}

Currently it is not possible to allow multiple mail servers to be configured in Confluence. One would, for example,  like to associate a specific space to a mail server or define other constraints. 

According to JF in regards to configuring multiple mail servers.

    * accidental feature, and we only ever actually use one of those configs (in which case, how do we know which one it uses?)
    * allowing the administrator to switch between mailservers, so only one config is active at any time
    * allowing a failover system in the way we use multiple LDAP servers: if the first one fails, try the next
fields.summary: Support Multiple Mail Servers in Confluence

fields.description:
We face very often scenarios were customers want to use confluence as a customer channel, using one or more spaces to expose them to communicate with clients, there are several permissions issues for this to be a really good solution, mainly:

# The one this issue is about: Any body with a view permission to a page can actually view the whole history... not good in some cases and the work around is very tedious (create-edit...- copy - delete original to loose history, etc.. what if you need the history?).
# The one referenced on [this issue|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6647] specific to view source permissions
# The one referenced on [this issue|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-5095] specific to edit permissions being inherited.
# The one referenced on [this issue|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6328] specific to hiding links to pages that users have no view permission to.

Resolving this issue and the ones referenced would make confluence a lot easier to sell as a customer channel communication tool :)
thanks!
fields.summary: Restrict view history for a user or group (perhaps a view history permission?)

fields.description:
We have consistently seen the following problem:

If you have notifications (watches, space watch or daily update email) set for a page, you will get the wrong name in the notification when someone moves a page in the wiki. For instance, let's say John updates a certain page. That email notification will correctly show John as the updater. Then, if Joe moves the same page to another location in the wiki space (without updating it), the notification that goes out will show that John made the move (presumably because John was the last person to update the page and Joe's name is not stored since he didn't make any updates).

I posted this to the forums and others have found this to be reproducible.  Also, others have mentioned that the same thing may occur when pages are deleted.
fields.summary: Email notifications show wrong name when page is moved

fields.description: The upgrade task that moves space logos to a SpaceDescription attachment runs before the upgrade task that migrates to the new way we store attachments in the file system. The first task creates new attachments using the new heirarchy before the old attachments have been migrated. This causes the attachment migration to fail because the directory it needs to create already exists and it doesn't want to overwrite it.
fields.summary: Upgrading from any version before 2.9 to 3.0 doesn't migrate attachments and/or breaks custom space logos

fields.description:
Confluence 2.8 was released in April 2008, which puts it beyond our "two major versions or six months" policy for retaining deprecated methods and classes.

We should

* Remove methods and classes deprecated in 2.8 or earlier where possible
* Err on the side of caution if the class is (a) recently deprecated and (b) likely to be used in plugins or themes
* Publish a list of what we removed with the next 3.1 DR
fields.summary: Remove methods and classes deprecated in 2.8 or earlier
